list_definition.definition: a storm of wind, carrying with it clouds of sand

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We were caught in a sandstorm in the desert.

list_ex_of_english: They are subjected to sandstorms, flies and mosquitoes.
The battle then solidified into a stalemate which lasted until dusk, when a sandstorm obscured the battlefield.
The semiarid steppe landscape was drained by intermittent streams and was sometimes affected by dust and sandstorms, and moisture was seasonal.
In order to protect the residents from sandstorms and dust, the yards were surrounded on all sides by walls to become courtyards.
The battle solidified into a stalemate until dusk, when a sandstorm obscured the battlefield.
There was a sandstorm and light rain.
Later in the day, winds increased to gale force and a sandstorm reduced visibility to 400 m.
Reporters on the ground blamed a sandstorm and low visibility from the air for the lack of air-strikes the previous day.
